documentation.text:
An interface for the metaverse core contract. This is meant
 to be used from inside the metaverse plug-ins (typically on
 plug-in initialization).

This is the list of plug-ins that are being added to the hub.
 Each contract has its separate logic but they have access to
 the same set of features. Once a contract is added, it will
 never be removed from this list. This mapping tells whether
 a contract in particular has permission(s) to define a type
 and mint tokens for an address.
The linked brand registry for this metaverse.
The linked economy for this metaverse.

Defines the resolution of a fungible token type. A brand id may be
 provided (or address(0) for system FTs). This method must yield the
 NEXT id to use (it will NOT be a view, but will returns a value anyway).
 The returned id will be in the range of FTs.

Defines the resolution of a non-fungible token type. This method must
 yield the NEXT id to use (it will NOT be a view, but will returns a
 value anyway). The returned id will be in the range of NFTs.
Mints a specific fungible token type, in a certain amount.

Mints a specific non-fungible token type, using a specific id (and always using
 an amount of 1). It is an error if the token id is already minted, or the chosen
 id is < (1 << 160) since those ids are reserved for brands.
Mints a specific brand token for a given user. The brand is stated as its address.

Retrieves the metadata uri of a given token. WARNING: This method
 will consume a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so
 it is recommended to invoke this method in the context of a
 CALL, and never in the context of a SEND (even as part of other
 contract's code).

Hook to be invoked as part of a burn process when an address burns
 a particular token in some quantity (for NFTs, the quantity is 1
 in every case). By this point, we should be guaranteed that the
 _tokenId will actually have a resolver (being it a fungible token
 type, or being it a non-fungible token id).

Hook to be invoked as part of a batch burn process when an address
 burns a particulars et of tokens in respective quantities (for NFTs,
 the quantity is 1 in every case; it is guaranteed that both arrays
 are always of the same length.
Hook to be invoked as part of a transfer from ERC1155.

 to be used from inside the metaverse plug-ins (typically on
 plug-in initialization).

This is the list of plug-ins that are being added to the hub.
 Each contract has its separate logic but they have access to
 the same set of features. Once a contract is added, it will
 never be removed from this list. This mapping tells whether
 a contract in particular has permission(s) to define a type
 and mint tokens for an address.
The linked brand registry for this metaverse.
The linked economy for this metaverse.

Defines the resolution of a fungible token type. A brand id may be
 provided (or address(0) for system FTs). This method must yield the
 NEXT id to use (it will NOT be a view, but will returns a value anyway).
 The returned id will be in the range of FTs.

Defines the resolution of a non-fungible token type. This method must
 yield the NEXT id to use (it will NOT be a view, but will returns a
 value anyway). The returned id will be in the range of NFTs.
Mints a specific fungible token type, in a certain amount.

Mints a specific non-fungible token type, using a specific id (and always using
 an amount of 1). It is an error if the token id is already minted, or the chosen
 id is < (1 << 160) since those ids are reserved for brands.
Mints a specific brand token for a given user. The brand is stated as its address.

Retrieves the metadata uri of a given token. WARNING: This method
 will consume a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so
 it is recommended to invoke this method in the context of a
 CALL, and never in the context of a SEND (even as part of other
 contract's code).

Hook to be invoked as part of a burn process when an address burns
 a particular token in some quantity (for NFTs, the quantity is 1
 in every case). By this point, we should be guaranteed that the
 _tokenId will actually have a resolver (being it a fungible token
 type, or being it a non-fungible token id).

Hook to be invoked as part of a batch burn process when an address
 burns a particulars et of tokens in respective quantities (for NFTs,
 the quantity is 1 in every case; it is guaranteed that both arrays
 are always of the same length.
Hook to be invoked as part of a transfer from ERC1155.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

brandRegistry().notice: The linked brand registry for this metaverse.

defineNextFTType(address).notice: Defines the resolution of a fungible token type. A brand id may be provided (or address(0) for system FTs). This method must yield the NEXT id to use (it will NOT be a view, but will returns a value anyway). The returned id will be in the range of FTs.

defineNextNFTType().notice: Defines the resolution of a non-fungible token type. This method must yield the NEXT id to use (it will NOT be a view, but will returns a value anyway). The returned id will be in the range of NFTs.

economy().notice: The linked economy for this metaverse.

mintBrandFor(address,address).notice: Mints a specific brand token for a given user. The brand is stated as its address.

mintFTFor(address,uint256,uint256,bytes).notice: Mints a specific fungible token type, in a certain amount.

mintNFTFor(address,uint256,uint256,bytes.notice: Mints a specific non-fungible token type, using a specific id (and always using an amount of 1). It is an error if the token id is already minted, or the chosen id is < (1 << 160) since those ids are reserved for brands.

onBrandOwnerChanged(address,address).notice: Hook to be invoked as part of a transfer from ERC1155.

onTokenBurned(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Hook to be invoked as part of a burn process when an address burns a particular token in some quantity (for NFTs, the quantity is 1 in every case). By this point, we should be guaranteed that the _tokenId will actually have a resolver (being it a fungible token type, or being it a non-fungible token id).

onTokensBurned(address,uint256[],uint256.notice: Hook to be invoked as part of a batch burn process when an address burns a particulars et of tokens in respective quantities (for NFTs, the quantity is 1 in every case; it is guaranteed that both arrays are always of the same length.

plugins(address).notice: This is the list of plug-ins that are being added to the hub. Each contract has its separate logic but they have access to the same set of features. Once a contract is added, it will never be removed from this list. This mapping tells whether a contract in particular has permission(s) to define a type and mint tokens for an address.

tokenURI(uint256).notice: Retrieves the metadata uri of a given token. WARNING: This method will consume a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so it is recommended to invoke this method in the context of a CALL, and never in the context of a SEND (even as part of other contract's code).

userdoc.notice: An interface for the metaverse core contract. This is meant to be used from inside the metaverse plug-ins (typically on plug-in initialization).
